fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA Issue macro doesn't render correctly if the server name is incorrect. 
Example:
- <ac:parameter ac:name="server">JIRA (myinstance.atlassian.net)</ac:parameter>
instead of
- <ac:parameter ac:name="server">System JIRA</ac:parameter>

h3. Environment
* 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* 

h3. Expected Results
Issues are shown by the macro.

h3. Actual Results
Refresh didn't work. Try again or click an issue to see it in JIRA.
 
h3. Notes
* 

h3.Workaround
# Open the macro on edition mode
# Click on the _magnifying glass_ to refresh the search
# Click on _insert_ button
# Save the page
fields.summary: JIRA Issue macro doesn't render correctly

fields.description:
h3. Allow administrators to change what is displayed on Activity Stream:

* Enable or Disable links to Attachments on updated Pages
* Show or Hide updates for a Specific Space / Page
* Show or Hide updates done by a specific user
fields.summary: Enable Customization on Activity Stream

fields.description:
The French translation for favorites page reads 'Sauvegarder pour plus tard' which means 'Saved for later'.

The text should read 'Favoris' or 'Mes favoris'
fields.summary: French Translation: View my favorites page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using Instruction text in blueprints, you are able to select the JIRA Issue Macro option to search and create issues through it, although when you create a page from this template, you cannot use the JIRA Issue Macro inside the Instruction text.

h3. Environment
Cloud - Confluence 1000.0.0-781c963

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit a template blueprint
# Place an instruction text and select JIRA Issue Macro option for the field.
# Create a page with this template
# Try to interact with the field as described on the documentation

h3. Expected Results
We should be able to search for issues and create issues like described on the documentation:
- https://developer.atlassian.com/confdev/confluence-plugin-guide/confluence-blueprints/instruction-text-in-blueprints

h3. Actual Results
Nothing Happens
 
h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: JIRA Issues Macro for Instruction text doesn't work

fields.description:
h3. Issue

When copying and pasting images (clipboard or drag n drop) directly into confluence cloud without using the insert files/images macro the images will not appear on any mobile devices. A thumbnail renders with a broken image icon and when you click on it get cannot open file.

When images are inserted this way they can be seen properly on the full desktop web client regardless if the images macro is used or copy/clipboard.
h3. Workaround

When commenting or creating the initial page the "insert files and images" macro via {{Ctrl+M}} has to be used for the image to properly render on BOTH the native mobile iOS & Android apps as well as the mobile browser login (iOS and Android browsers)
fields.summary: [Confluence Mobile] Copy/Paste jpg and png images displays images on desktop but not mobile.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a [Status Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/status-macro-724765291.html] is inserted into a page, you're normally able to click it once and it will allow you to select a color.

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create Confluence page
# Insert Status Macro, select a color and give it a label, submit it.
# Now you will see the macro, and you should be able to click it once to select a new color.

h3. Expected Results
Should appear like this:
 !Screen Shot 2017-10-13 at 5.37.34 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
Looks like this:
 !Screen Shot 2017-10-13 at 5.27.54 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Unable to select colors when editing Status Macro with mouse-over menu

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* Changing default current Cyrlic font language.
fields.summary: Changing default current Cyrlic font language

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Balsamiq mockups failed to load with 404 error.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to a page which has a Balsamiq Mockup added

h3. Expected Results
Balsamiq image loads

h3. Actual Results
Sample request which hit to 404:
{code}
https://bas.balsamiq.com/confluence/fetch?attachmentID=att937xxxxx&platformToken=eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9..kuvyqb5V-Q2mkivn6RRIlweZsdtCrg0w22nIB-F1_ls
{code}

h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: Balsamiq mockups failed to load with 404 error

fields.description:
h3. Summary

On a draft page, adding a Balsamiq Mockups Macro fails and results with a 403
h3. Environment

Replicated on Firefox and Chrome
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # create a draft page
 # launch the Balsamiq Mockups 3 addon form the "+" menu
 # the add-on is not able to retrieve the attachment descriptor and fails

h3. Expected Results

the add-on is able to retrieve the attachment descriptor
h3. Actual Results

the add-on is not able to retrieve the attachment descriptor and fails
 !Balsamiq on Page Creation.jpg|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Publish the page first prior to inserting the macro

UPDATE

We are receiving reports from customers unable to access attachments descriptors also from pre-existing pages. So it seems that the issue does not affect only DRAFT pages.

From customer: _"All pages that we updated recently are affected with this problem. Pages, changed longer ago are working fine."_

The workaround proposed (save the page before launching the add-on) is not applicable in this cases.
fields.summary: Balsamiq mockups failed to load with 404 error - retrieval of attachment descriptor fails

fields.description: Bug (Chrome / desktop): if you add an animated .PNG file it animates fine but if you resize PNG file it stops animating !Screen Shot 2017-10-12 at 4.14.10 pm.png!
fields.summary: Resized PNG file stops animating on Chrome desktop

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Customer is not able to use filters on the JIRA Issue Calendar on a Confluence page, when the customer sets a filter the following message appears:
"The filter chosen for this issue calendar either does not exist or is not shared with you".

JIRA error when attempting to load the page containing the JCAL macro:
{code}2017-10-10 16:03:06.320	ERROR	com.atlassian.jira.ext.calendar.HtmlCalendar	The project chosen (null) doesn't exist or that user doesn't the appropriate permission. Invalid searchId given 10004	Invalid searchId given 10004	{code}

h3. Environment
Cloud - Confluence 1000.0.0-a3ab3aa

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to a Confluence page
# Edit the page and add a JIRA Issue Calendar macro to it
# Set it with the a filter
# It will load and the message will be displayed: "The filter chosen for this issue calendar either does not exist or is not shared with you".


h3. Expected Results
The results from the filter should be displayed.

h3. Actual Results
"The filter chosen for this issue calendar either does not exist or is not shared with you"
 
h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: The filter chosen for this issue calendar either does not exist or is not shared with you

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* Live search macro is not showing suggestion page for the anonymous user when typing.

h3. How to Replicate
# Create a page in Confluence.
# Insert the live search macro.
# Publish the page.
# Try to search page using the live search macro.

h3.Expected Result
* When the Anonymous user searches the page using the live search macro the suggestion page is showing.

h3.Actual Result
* When the Anonymous user searches the page using the live search macro the suggestion page is showing.

h3.Workaround
# After typing the page title inside the search macro > Press Enter.
fields.summary: Live search macro is not showing suggestion page for the anonymous user when typing.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently there's no way to hide sidebar from anonymous users.
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide an option to hide sidebar from anonymous users.
h3. Workaround
 * None. There used to be well-known workaround for this use case like answers below, however, after SPA is enabled, Confluence no longer supports style macro. See also ---CONFCLOUD-57189---.
 ** [Solved: How to hide the "spaces"-Button in Confluence Clou... |https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-questions/How-to-hide-the-quot-spaces-quot-Button-in-Confluence-Cloud/qaq-p/308563]
 ** [How to hide the "space tools" menu from anonymous ... |https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Questions-for-Confluence/How-to-hide-the-quot-space-tools-quot-menu-from-anonymous-users/qaq-p/5084]
fields.summary: Ability to hide sidebar from anonymous users

fields.description:
The RSS Feed Macro is only available for the server users. Please make it available for the cloud users!

https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/rss-feed-macro-724765278.html
fields.summary: RSS Feed Macro for Confluence Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Large Livesearch Macro doesn't render on Confluence Cloud Mobile App
h3. Environment

Confluence Mobile app
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Page
 # Add a Livesearch macro to it
 # Set the macro size to 'large'
 # Access this page through Confluence Cloud Mobile App (iOS)

h3. Expected Results

The page should load and the macro should appear.
h3. Actual Results

The macro doesn't appear on the page.
h3. Workaround

Set the macro size to 'medium'
fields.summary: Large Livesearch Macro doesn't render on Confluence Cloud Mobile App
highlighting a table column in Confluence takes you to the top of that column

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* According to our [Decisions Blueprint Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/decisions-blueprint-937893638.html]:
{quote}Once you save your first decision page, Confluence will create a decision register page for the space you're in, and add a shortcut to it in the space's sidebar. The decision register and lists all the decisions in that space.
{quote}{panel}
h6. Steps to replicate
 # Create a Decision page

h6. Actual Behavior

Doesn't create a new Decisions register page
h6. Expected Behavior

Decisions register page is created
fields.summary: Unable to create a Decisions register page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
Once you save a troubleshooting articles page, Confluence will create an index page and add a shortcut on your space sidebar. The index page lists the pages in the space.

  {panel}

h6. Steps to replicate
# Create a Troubleshooting or meeting notes or How-to articles

h6. Actual Behavior
Doesn't create a new index page 

h6. Expected Behavior
Meeting notes index is created
fields.summary: Unable to create an index page for any blueprint (Troubleshooting, Retrospective, How To, etc)

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install RefinedTheme
# Create a theme on a space, make sure there are rounded corners in the theme
# Save
# Go to Space Home (corners are rounded)
# Go to Pages or any page or blog

h3. Expected Results
There are rounded corners on the all the pages.

h3. Actual Results
The corners are right (90 degrees without any roundness). On the space home they are rounded, but on all the pages rendered by Atlassian (as I understand it), the setting is ignored.
 !PagesNoCorners.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
In Firefox, everytime a page is opened, there's this warning
 !Failed to validate origin.jpg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Corners on theme only showing up on space home, not pages nor blogs

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The Table of Content Macro can show Duplicate Entries for content on a page if the Text Selected by the Heading Level exists within a Table

h3. Environment
* Cloud 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a New Confluence Page
# Add a Table of Contents Macro; for this example, Minimum Heading Level 3 and Maximum Heading Level 7
# Add a Table; for this Example 2x4 where Cell 1B's Text is Heading 3
# Publish Page 
Example:
 !TableOfContents-Edit.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Table of Contents shows a single entry 

h3. Actual Results
Ths intermittently occurs but Duplication Appears for all Text that exists within a Table:
 !TableOfContents-View.png|thumbnail! 

The Table of Contents Macro Preview within the Editor displays correctly: 
!Preview.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
If the Text does not exist within a Table, the Table of Contents Macro renders it correctly
The Table of Contents Macro will intermittently load correctly on a page refresh

h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: Duplicate Entries in Table of Content Macro

fields.description:
h3. Summary

User using Internet Explorer edge with add page, and add comment space permissions is unable to add inline comments.
They are able to add inline comments using Chrome without any issue.

h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)
* Internet Explorer Edge

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a user with sufficient space permissions to add inline comments, but not all space permissions.
# Using Internet Explorer Edge, try to add an inline comment to a page.

h3. Expected Results

The comment is added without any issues.

h3. Actual Results
The comment is not added.
You instead get the following error:
"Could not save the Comment"
 
h3. Notes
This issue does not show up in Chrome.

h3.Workarounds
- Adding all the space permissions to the user will allow them to add the comments.
- Using another browser such as google chrome will also work without needing to change the Space permissions.
fields.summary: Internet Explorer Edge fails to add inline comments unless user has all space permissions.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Horizontal scroll bar is slow and jumping when trying to use it on Windows 7 for Google Chrome 61.0.3163.79

h3. Environment
Cloud - Confluence 1000.0.0-1ba929d

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Get to a page with some content and big tables on it, to scroll down the screen.
# Enter windowed mode
# Try to scroll the screen horizontally

h3. Expected Results
The scroll should work smoothly

h3. Actual Results
The scroll is very slow to scroll and also jumps, not possible to have control of it.
 
h3.Workaround
- Use another browser
fields.summary: Scroll Bar slow on Windowed Mode

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using the [Documentation Template|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/develop-technical-documentation-in-confluence-724765468.html#DevelopTechnicalDocumentationinConfluence-CreateyourDocumentationSpace] in order to create spaces, the same will not bring the default shortcuts on the sidebar. 

Specifically, only the *Pages* and *Space Tools* are displayed/bundled with the template. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In Confluence, got to *Spaces* and click on *Create Space*
# Select the *Documentation Space* template
# After setting up the space title/key, make sure to click on *Create*
# Access the new created space

h3. Expected Results
The space should bring the default options for the sidebar, such as *Overview*, *Blogs* and add-ons as the screenshot below:
!nav.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results
The space will only have the *Pages* and *Space Tools* options displayed on the sidebar:
!nav2.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Notes
The shortcuts will still be in the space itself. If the user clicks on the option to *edit* the sidebar (pencil on the bottom of the same), the shortcuts can be enabled by simply clicking on the '+' icon:
!short.png|thumbnail!

h3.Workaround
Manually add the shortcuts back by editing the sidebar.
fields.summary: Shortcuts Not Created when Using the Space Documentation Template

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using the [Confluence Documentation Template|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/develop-technical-documentation-in-confluence-724765468.html] for a space creation, the content inserted on the *Description* field will not be saved. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In Confluence, got to *Spaces* and click on *Create Space*
# Select the *Documentation Space* template
# Insert any text on the *Description* field and *Create*:
!doc.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results
The content added to the description should be saved and included as the space description. 

h3. Actual Results
No content is added. The description is blank:
!description.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
No workaround found at the moment.
fields.summary: Documentation Template Does Not Save the Space's Description

fields.description:
In Confluence, when using the [Content by Label Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/content-by-label-macro-724765178.html] to retrieve attachments on the page, the same will be prompt to be downloaded, instead of previewed as the default behavior. 

This is a suggestion to have the attachments being previewed instead of automatically downloaded while using the macro to retrieve the content in the page.
fields.summary: Preview Attachments When Using Content by Label Macro

fields.description:
h3. Summary
 * Macro browser is missing if have a lot of add-ons installed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create the page.
 # Click the plus(+) drop-down menu on Confluence Editor.

h3. Expected Results
 * Able to find Other macros option.

h3. Actual Results
 * Other macros option is disappeared.

h3. Workaround
 * Use Ctrl + ⇧ + A(for Win user) or ⌘ + ⇧ + A(for Mac user) keyboard shortcut to open the macro browser.
fields.summary: Macro browser is missing if have a lot of add-on installed.

fields.description: h3. Summary Jira issue macros are failing to display properly randomly in Confluence. * Report macros are displaying the error: _Getting issues.._ * Single Jira issue macros are displaying: _Data cannot be retrieved due to an unexpected error._ on Chrome and _Data cannot be retrieved due to an unexpected error. HTTP/2.0 500_ on Safari. h3. Steps to Reproduce # This issue appears and disappears randomly so it is hard to have proper steps to reproduce it. h3. Expected Results The Jira issue macros are properly displayed. h3. Actual Results The macros are displaying the following error messages: {noformat} "Data cannot be retrieved due to an unexpected error" on Chrome "Data cannot be retrieved due to an unexpected error. HTTP/2.0 500" on Safari "Getting issues.." For list of Jira issues. {noformat} The following error is displayed in Confluence logs: {code} Uncaught exception thrown by REST service: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Duplicate key [ 0 issues {code} h3.Workaround Not a proper workaround but the issue seems to resolved itself after a few minutes but keeps on coming back.
fields.summary: Jira Issue macros failing intermittently on Confluence

fields.description:
It'd be great that wherever you are (Safari, Twitter, Mail,whatssup,...)  Confluence was one of the options to share stuff.

It could make a new blog entry, for example, or an entry using the 'shared link' templatee
fields.summary: Share in Confluence iOs button

fields.description:
Currently, there are some macros that are not supported - and due to that, they are not displayed - on Confluence Mobile apps, such as below:

* *Gliffy*
* *draw.io*
* *SmartDraw*
fields.summary: Increase the number of supported macros on Confluence Mobile apps

fields.description:
h2. Problem description
The fix applied on the CONFCLOUD-56861 bug doesn't cover all use cases and some customers are still being affected by this issue, where the Atlassian Companion app can't correctly identify the OS level proxy settings and use it.

h2. Workaround
"_atlassian-domain-for-localhost-connections-only.com_" can be added to the proxy exception list for the app to work.
fields.summary: Atlassian Companion still can't respect OS level proxy settings for some use cases

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* Using the French format font intermittently causing the editor hang/unreachable.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create the page.
# Copy and paste the content that using French format from another editor.

h3. Expected Results
* Able to use the French format font.

h3. Actual Results
* When editing from Confluence editor intermittently the editor hang/unreachable.

h3.Workaround
* Using regular format e.g Times New Roman.
fields.summary: Using the French format font intermittently causing the editor hang/unreachable.

fields.description: I would like to configure Confluence cloud this way that all employees arrive at the same landing-page (our intranet). due to the latest changes by Atlassian the option is not available anymore to set a default homepage. Is there a workaround? I can imagine that I am not the only one with this question so maybe you have an answer..
fields.summary: Determine landingpage

fields.description:
h3. Summary
 * When adding a Questions List Macro in a page the option to include an *Ask Button* is not being displayed in the macro creation.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to a page and add the Question List Macro
 # Inform the macro's parameters
 # Choose a space will be last option provided

!question_list_macro.png|thumbnail!
h3. Expected Results

The include an *Ask button* should listed under the macro parameters
h3. Actual Results

Include an *Ask Button* is not displayed in the macro parameters
h3. Workaround

Instead of using the ask button, *add a link* to ask a Question to a page.

Asking a question in the global questions space, this link will take you to the same place as choosing *Create* > *Ask a question*.
{code:java}
https://<hostname>/wiki/plugins/servlet/ac/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-questions/globalQuestionsViewer?ac.com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-questions.path=/questions/ask{code}
 

Asking questions in a space, this link will take you to the same place as choosing *Create* > *Ask a question* within a space.
{code:java}
https://<hostname>/wiki/display/<spaceKey>/customcontent/list/ac%3Acom.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-questions%3Aquestion?ac.com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-questions.path=/questions/ask{code}
fields.summary: Question List macro does not give the option to include an Ask Button

fields.description: Provide a function / macro that would allow users to set text snippets inside the application to be used through shortcuts inside Confluence Editor.
fields.summary: Allow Users to Define Text Snippets / Shortcuts in Confluence Editor

fields.description:
h3. ARCHIVE a confluence space using REST API
h3. Environment

Confluence Cloud Vertigo
 REST API calls
h3. Steps to Reproduce

These are the commands currenlty available:
{noformat}
Spaces  GET /rest/api/space
Create space  POST /rest/api/space
Create private space   POST /rest/api/space/_private
Update   PUT /rest/api/space/{spaceKey}
Delete  DELETE /rest/api/space/{spaceKey}
Space GET /rest/api/space/{spaceKey}
Contents  GET /rest/api/space//content
Contents with type   GET /rest/api/space/
Get space settings  GET /rest/api/space/
Update space settings PUT /rest/api/space/{spaceKey}/settings 
{noformat}
h3. Expected Results

Archive
 ARCHIVE /rest/api/space/\{spaceKey}
h3. Actual Results

The only options we see are to Delete, Update or Create
h3. Notes

Customer is rightfully worried about relying on deprecated methods listed below, that appear to work, for now.
h3. Workaround
{quote}[https://developer.atlassian.com/confdev/deprecated-apis/confluence-xml-rpc-and-soap-apis/remote-confluence-methods]
 The following code seems to work:
 ```
 requestArray = []
 requestArray.append(confluence_space_key)
 requestArray.append('ARCHIVED')
 url = self.confluence_server_url + '/rpc/json-rpc/confluenceservice-v2/setSpaceStatus'
 response = self.session.post(url,
 headers=
 Unknown macro: \{'Content-Type'}
 ,
 data=json.dumps(requestArray))
 ```
 The only thing that worries me a bit is the warning at the top of the page above, which states:
 ```
 The XML-RPC and SOAP APIs are deprecated since Confluence 5.5. 
 Confluence has a new REST API that is progressively replacing our existing APIs. We recommend plugin developers use the new REST APIs where possible.
 ```


{quote}
fields.summary: Unable to issue ARCHIVE command with REST

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In Questions for Confluence, when answering a question, you cannot post an answer with a linked URL that contains an "&" in the link.

for example:
"https://www.google.com/search?q=searching&source=lnms"
will fail.
"https://www.google.com/search?q=searching"
will work fine.

h3. Environment

Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a question in Confluence Questions.
# Attempt to answer that question with a link to a URL that contains an "&" for example "https://www.google.com/search?q=searching&source=lnms" (Please note that it must be a link and not just the raw text. The raw text will go through without any issues.
# post the answer

h3. Expected Results

The answer is posted with the link as expected.

h3. Actual Results
No errors in the Browser console.
No Network traffic.
You will see an error like this:
=== Error ===
 !Failed to create content.png|thumbnail! 
===
The Content is not posted.
 
h3. Notes
Note that the link will post if the destination no longer contains an ampersand.

h3.Workarounds
Select one of the following:
- Use a tinyurl to encode the extra URL information without the ampersand.
- Paste the link as plain-text
fields.summary: Cannot Post Answer in Confluence questions that contains a linked URL with an Ampersand

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The 'Agile Wallboard' macro in Confluence Cloud is not working properly. After being added the gadget will not display the board and instead will display the following message. 

{code}
{"message":"Client must be authenticated to access this resource.","status-code":401}
{code}

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud
* 1000.0.0-f00cd64

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a JIRA project populated with issues
# Create a page in the linked Confluence
# Add 'Agile Wallboard Gadget' and to the page and publish it

h3. Expected Results
Agile Wallboard gadget should display the selected project board

h3. Actual Results
Error is shown 
 !Screen Shot 2017-10-06 at 16.55.27.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
# All permissions are correctly set both in JIRA and Confluence

h3.Workaround
No Workaround yet
fields.summary: Agile Wallboard Gadget requesting authentication to user already authenticated

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If you upload a visio file in Confluence and display it through macros, some areas of the diagram will be blacked. This does not happen when seeing on other applications.

# Upload it to a page and display it with a macro

h3. Expected Results
The diagram should be displayed on the page without issues
h3. Actual Results
The diagram is displayed with black areas on it.
 
h3.Workaround
No workarounds
fields.summary: Black areas in Visio files preview
Limited Width Layout for Widescreens

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* Limit the add-on that shows in the macro browser when opening it with "\{".

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install the add-on more than 15 add-on

h3. Expected Results
* Ability to limit the add-on show on the macro browser when opening it with "\{".

h3. Actual Results
* No limitation add-on on the macro browser.

h3.Workaround
* Disable some of the add-on installed.
fields.summary: Ability to limit the add-on that shows in the macro browser when opening it with "{".

fields.description:
Hello,

Recently, I have started seeing a new kind of spam. The steps to reproduce seem to be:

# The attacker registers a throwaway account at atlassian.net.
# The attacker creates a page whose content is unimportant. It may even be restricted.
# The attacker uses “Share” functionality to send a link to the page of step 2 and an arbitrary note text to an arbitrary list of email addresses.

Observed behavior:

# I receive an email message of the following form:{code}
From: {user name} (Confluence)
Subject: [Confluence] {user name} shared "{page title}" with you

{user name} shared {page title} with {my email address}

# {page title}

> {optional note}

[View page]

Get notifications and comment on the go, with Confluence Cloud for mobile. Download it for iPhone or Android
 
Also shared with

{list of other victims}
{code}
# Other victims presumably receive the same message but with my address in the “also shared with” list.
# The \{user name}, \{page title} and \{optional note} fields are all controlled by the attacker. They typically have the text to the effect of “you received $78” or so, and the optional note additionally contains a link to a scam web site.

Impact:

# I receive an annoying email message.
# My email address is disclosed to all other victims of the same “share” operation, who can then send me more spam or through neglect provide my address to third parties who will send me more spam.
# I click the “Report spam” in my email client, which, if enough people consistently do this, may eventually lead to confluence@*.atlassian.net being blacklisted by major email services.
# Bad guys get some web traffic and some of the more gullible victims’ money.

----

Since this is a Suggestion issue, I hereby Suggest that:

# Confluence should not include the list of other recipients in such emails. This mitigates the information disclosure.
# Confluence should not send Share emails to recipients who would not be able to view the page being shared (because of restrictions).
# There should be a way for a registered user to indicate that they are not expecting to participate in any of Confluence Cloud’s hosted wikis.
fields.summary: Please do not allow spam

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, when linking a Confluence Space to Service Desk the setting "Any active user can view this space" is enabled automatically in the Confluence space. That means, that any Confluence users, regardless of not being Service Desk customers will be able to view the space, regardless of the space permissions.
h3. Suggested Solution

Restrict the access strictly to the Service Desk customers and the Confluece users specified in the space permissions.
fields.summary: Restrict access to Service Desk knowledge base spaces to Service Desk customers only

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* Navigation is not showing when deleting the space.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to space tools > Overview tab > Delete Space > OK.

h3. Expected Results
* Navigation on the left sidebar should show navigation to the other space.

h3. Actual Results
* Navigation is disappearing when deleting the space.
 !screenshot-1.png! 

h3.Workaround
* Change the URL and refresh the page.
fields.summary: Navigation is not showing when deleting the space.

fields.description: Based on this page [https://confluence.atlassian.com/conf58/manage-watchers-771892524.html] , it looks like only space admin is allowed to manage watcher, it will be good to extend that capability to page owner as well.
fields.summary: Allow page owner to manage watcher

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Occasionally, on publish of a page, the existing or updated content of a code block in the page will be missing or will no longer display correctly.

h3. Environment
This is known to impact the following browsers:
- Firefox

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Note that the issue is intermittent and very difficult to reproduce on purpose.
# create a page with some Code blocks with content like the output of a typical shell/console.
# Edit the page repeatedly, saving often


h3. Expected Results

Page saves with no data loss.

h3. Actual Results
The data in some or all of the Code Blocks is missing or does not display correctly
 
h3. Notes
NA

h3.Workaround
There is no known workaround
fields.summary: Content Corruption of Code Blocks after publishing pages

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Users are unable to publish changes to a page they've updated and receive a message indicating that their Browser is "Unable to Communicate with Server"

h3. Environment
* Cloud 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create two spaces. 
# Create a new page in one of the spaces. 
# Copy the page (... > Copy)
# Click the *Location* icon > *Search* link.
# Search for the desired space (fill the space name in the search field > click Search). 
# Select the space/parent page. 
# Click *Move* 
# Click *Save*.

h3. Expected Results
Page is published 

h3. Actual Results
Message appears that states:
{quote}Unable to communicate with server. Saving is not possible at the moment.{quote}
After a few seconds, the popup message will state:
{quote}Successfully Reconnected
We're back in business. You're free to save your page again.{quote}
However the page cannot be published

Confluence logs show:
{noformat}
2017-10-05 17:06:26.825946500 2017-10-05 17:06:26,824 WARN [http-bio-2009-exec-755 [tenantId:system-tenant] [traceId:97156542a52f8b70]] [rest.api.model.ExceptionConverter] convertServiceException Could not map exception type java.lang.IllegalArgumentException to a specific REST status. Defaulting to InternalServerError {}
2017-10-05 17:06:26.825947500 java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Can't add a parent from another space.
...
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
Similar to this Server Bug: CONFSERVER-44167
Some customers have confirmed that their pages had been moved from another Space many months before they tried to update the pages

h3.Workaround
Create a Copy of the Page by either using the Copy Function within Confluence (... > Copy)
or Manually Create a New Page and Copy/Paste the Content from the Old Page into New.
fields.summary: Unable to Publish Page after moving page

fields.description: Users would like to be able to move the sidebar to the top, in order to have additional horizontal space.
fields.summary: Allow Users to Move the Confluence Bar to the top of the Page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
 * Code block macro syntax highlighting is not working for the Russian Language.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page.
 # Insert the code block macro.
 (e.g the content)
 <?xml>
 <cцлита легендос.> </цлита легендос.>
 <xml>
 # Set language to "HTML and XML"

h3. Expected Results
 * Able to syntax highlighting the Russian language.

h3. Actual Results
 * The syntax highlighting is not working for the Russian language.

h3. Workaround
 * No Workaround
fields.summary: Code block macro syntax highlighting is not working for XML in Russian

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When the title of the root page used for a *Children Display* macro includes a colon (*:*) and changes, the *Children display* macro using this page as root will appear as broken:
 !Screen Shot 2017-10-05 at 14.08.03.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Insert a *Children Display* macro on a page and specify as root a page which includes a colon.
# Go to that root page and change any part of the title page.
# Go back to the page using the *Children display* macro.

h3. Expected Results
The macro properly displays the children pages of the root chosen.

h3. Actual Results
An error message is displayed in a random language explaining that the page is not found.
If you open the page in edit mode, you will see that the macro is losing its *spacekey* attribute.
 
h3.Workaround
- If referencing the Children Pages from another Page in Confluence, remove the colon from the title of the Source Parent Page
or
- If referencing Children Pages of the Current Page, leave the "Parent Page" option blank
fields.summary: Children display macro breaks when the title of the root is changed and includes a colon

fields.description:
Hello, 

 

Today it happens quite often that a full backup of the JIRA/Confluence triggered at the wrong time takes the whole instance down

It would help much as a site-admin to have a button to kill the ongoing task that might kill the instance.

Or else, that would help to have a way to schedule a backup instead of an immediate run
fields.summary: Add a button to kill the ongoing backup

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* According to our [Meeting Notes Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/meeting-notes-blueprint-937893665.html]:
{quote}Once you save your page, Confluence will create an index page and add a shortcut on your space sidebar. The index page lists the latest Meeting Notes pages in the space.
{quote}
  {panel}

h6. Steps to replicate
# Create a meeting notes

h6. Actual Behavior
Doesn't create a new index page 

h6. Expected Behavior
Meeting notes index is created
fields.summary: Unable to create a Meeting Notes Index

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When users are logged in but attempt to view a space they do not have access to, they are shown an unhelpful 404 screen that states "Oops, you've found a dead link".
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Create a space restricted to User A, copy a link to that space
 # Log in as User B and attempt to access the URL copied in Step 1
 # Observe the following 404 screen:

!image-2017-10-05-00-04-19-181.png|thumbnail!
h3. Suggestion

This screen should help users understand that they may be attempting to access restricted content. Take this 404 screen as an example (shown for both a real 404 response, and the response when a user cannot view a page due to inherited restrictions):

!image-2017-10-05-00-06-33-475.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Improve 404 page to help users understand that content may be restricted

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Since the recent upgrade, the Confluence's page URL has changed to ".../pages/numericalvalue/..." and due to this, it is breaking most of the existing 'external' links on pages for various things. The redirection works for the older links: <instance>/wiki/display/<space> but it doesn't work for the link that has spaces included in the URL. i.e <instance>/wiki/spaces/<space> 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Go to <instance>/wiki/spaces/<space> 

h3. Expected Results
Redirect to the correct link

h3. Actual Results
Page Not Found Error
 
h3. Workaround
Change the word spaces to display in the URL bar of the browser.
fields.summary: "Page Not Found" error when using an old link
Some previous p2 CQ links show page not found

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA Gadgets Do not load when visiting a page with that Macro.
The Macro instead gives the following error: 
{noformat}
This gadget cannot be displayed on your dashboard. This could be due to a licensing problem or an application error. If you need this gadget, contact your administrator for assistance. Otherwise, you can remove it from your dashboard.
{noformat}

h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a sprint burndown Gadget to a page, Other JIRA gadgets that gather data on multiple issues will also work.
# view the page with the gadget after a good amount of time has passed.

h3. Expected Results

The Gadget Loads with no issues.

h3. Actual Results
The Gadget Does not load and you get the error as stated above.
 
h3. Notes
* Refreshing the page will load the gadget.
* When facing issues to load the gadget, the same will not be displayed on the macro browser as well.

h3.Workaround
Reload the page to view the gadget.
fields.summary: JIRA Gadget macros fail to load

fields.description:
h3. Summary
 * With the new Experience of Confluence, if you set the secondary color in Colour Scheme settings of the Look and Feel section to white, it'll cause the Questions for Confluence icon to disappear from the sidebar(white logo on white background

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click on settings from Confluence menu
 # Click on Colour Scheme from the menu
 # Change the color of the 2nd box to white

h3. Expected Results

Background is white but have Questions for Confluence logo show up in a complementary color so it's visible
h3. Actual Results

Questions for Confluence logo remains white making it invisible against the white background form the sidebar
fields.summary: Questions for Confluence Icon is Invisible if Setting background to White

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When viewing Confluence Questions, A small pop-up error shows up saying either:
{noformat}
Something went wrong

We are not sure what the problem is. Try again, and
contact your admin if it still doesn't work.
{noformat}

or

{noformat}
Unauthorized action

You're not allowed to perform this action. Ask your
admin to grant you permission.
{noformat}

Attempting to access the "Experts" Section shows no experts.

h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Access Confluence questions
# click the "Experts" Tab.

h3. Expected Results

Confluence Questions opens without any errors.
Experts are shown in the "Experts" Section.

h3. Actual Results
Error shows up in the bottom-left corner (see above for text)
In the Browser Dev tools Networking, you will see an error for the following call:
{noformat}
"https://confluence-questions.prod.atl-paas.net/rest/questions-connect/1.0/expert?start=0&limit=10"
{noformat}

Experts section lists no experts.

h3. Notes
NA

h3.Workaround
There is no workaround at this time.
fields.summary: Error When Accessing Questions for Confluence and can't see Experts

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* Ability to copy the content from Confluence editor to the gmail.com email editor.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Copy the content from Confluence editor that has the tasklist macro(checkbox).
# Pate it to gmail.com email editor.

h3. Expected Results
* Format on the gmail.com email editor should have a similar format on Confluence editor page.

h3. Actual Results
* Format on the gmail.com email editor has different formatting on Confluence editor page.

h3.Workaround
* No Workaround
fields.summary: Ability to copy the content from Confluence editor to the gmail.com email editor.
CQ expert missing answer and accepted stats

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The webhook page_viewed is not fired when viewing space Overview (home). This affects apps that are expecting the webhook.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Connect Inspector
 # *IMPORTANT:* Ensure the space home page does not contain any macros rendered in the fallback mode iframe (with an id that looks like {{embedded-fallback-mode-fake-addon-key__fallback-mode-fake-key__1d48435c}})
 # View a space home page (now called the "Overview")
 # Check the connect inspector and observe no "page_viewed" webhook is fired

h3. Expected Results

Viewing a space's Overview should fire page_viewed webhook.
h3. Actual Results

No page_viewed webhook is triggered when viewing a space's Overview.
h3. Notes

page_updated webhook gets triggered in space Overview.
h3. Workaround

Manually putting Page Tree, Roadmap Planner or Style macros in the overview triggers the page_viewed webhook moving forward.
fields.summary: ADG3 "Overview" (space home) doesn't fire "page_viewed" webhooks

fields.description:
h3. Summary

* With the new Experience of Confluence, if you set the secondary color in Colour Scheme settings of the Look and Feel section to white, it'll cause the Confluence icon to disappear (white logo on white background)

h3. Environment

* Confluence 1000.2054.0


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Click on settings from Confluence menu
# Click on Colour Scheme from the menu
# Change the colour of the 2nd box to white

h3. Expected Results

Background is white but have Confluence logo show up in a complementary color so it's visible

h3. Actual Results

Confluence logo remains white making it invisible against the white background
fields.summary: Confluence Icon is Invisible if Setting background to White

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When editing a page in Safari, users cannot publish a pasted image from clipboard.
h3. Environment

MacOS - Safari
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 - Put an image to the clipboard (cmd+shift+control+4 on Mac),
 - Edit a page in Safari
 - Paste the image. (Image can be viewed on the editor)
 - Click on Publish

h3. Expected Results

The image should be displayed on the published page.
h3. Actual Results

If the image is "large", attempting to publish the page will result in the following error :(
{quote}The page is too big to save. You could split into multiple pages, then use the include page macro to display the content
{quote}
Furthermore, once another user publishes the same page via another browser (collaborative editing), the pasted image will be published as *Broken Image*.

If the image small, you'll be able to publish, but you'll see a "broken image" on the view page.

!image-2017-10-16-17-22-31-890.png|width=100!
h3. Workaround

Pasting of images from clipboard works fine on Google Chrome and Firefox.
fields.summary: Cannot paste image from clipboard on Safari

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* Not able to open the page with the page properties report macro on Confluence IOS mobile application.

IOS mobile version:
* iOS 11.0.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Login from Confluence Mobile.
# Open the page with page properties report macro.

h3. Expected Results
* Able to open the page with the page properties report macro.

h3. Actual Results
* Not able to open the page and It's loading infinitely.

h3.Workaround
* No Workaround
fields.summary: Not able to open the page with the page properties report macro on Confluence IOS mobile application.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If a space is using *wiki* as its space key, the *Content report table* macro generated links will not redirect to the correct page when clicking on them.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a space and set its space key as *wiki*
# Label some pages with *labelA*.
# Add a *Content report table* macro filtering pages which uses the *labelA* label.
# Click on any link from the *wiki* space displayed in the *Content report table* macro.

h3. Expected Results
You are properly redirected to the page.

h3. Actual Results
A _Page not found_ error message is displayed.
 
h3.Workaround
Open the link in a new tab to get properly redirected.
fields.summary: Wrong redirection in the Content report table macro if a space use "wiki" as its space key

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* Some of the user unable to open the Experts tab in Question for Confluence add-on.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to exampe.atlassian.net/wiki.
# Click the Questions menu on the left sidebar.
# Click the Experts tab

Error from browser console:

!Error from browser console.png!
h3. Expected Results
* Able to see the Experts tab.

h3. Actual Results
* Nothing happens when clicking the Experts tab.

h3.Workaround
* No Workaround
fields.summary: Some of the user unable to open the Experts tab in Question for Confluence add-on.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When restrictions are applied to a space/site homepage, if you attempt to share it you will see a small added text with a clickable *Change* button displayed. Clicking on the *Change* button does nothing.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Attempt to share a space/site homepage with restrictions applied to it (*View* or *Edit* restrictions)
# Click on the *Change* button.

h3. Expected Results
The restrictions pop-up is displayed allowing you to change restrictions.

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens and the following error is thrown in the browser console:
 !Screen Shot 2017-10-03 at 10.44.54.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3.Workaround
You will need to use the *Restrictions* option in the page options instead.
fields.summary: Change button on the Share pop-up is not responsive for a space homepage

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The user list when using the *Share* feature is not scrollable making it difficult to browse users/groups when multiple results fits the search terms. Only 7 results are visible.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go on a page and use the *Share* feature.
# Use a keyword in the user list that is shared with more than 8 users/groups.

h3. Expected Results
The list is scrollable allowing you to browse through the search results.

h3. Actual Results
The list only displays 7 results and you cannot browse through the rest.
 
h3.Workaround
Right now users need to use a more precise search keyword to only returns the results they want to have.
fields.summary: User list in Share page is not scrollable

fields.description:
h3. Problem
As customers, we are not able to configure pages to have restrictions directly on the template, we must use the inherited permissions or add manually, although we're not able to add it directly to templates.

h3. Suggestions
Allow adding restrictions to page templates. Also we want to ask for an enhancement to be added to allow page level restrictions/permissions override space level restrictions. Maybe also with the option to, from the space level, enforce space level restrictions/permissions to all child pages.

h3. Workarounds
None
fields.summary: Configure restrictions on Page Templates

fields.description:
Tested on [https://mezzanine.jira-dev.com/wiki] with the Smart Links macro using a Bitbucket repository URL.

Steps to repro:
 * Go to [https://mezzanine.jira-dev.com/wiki]
 * Create the plus icon and create a new page
 * Paste [https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/atlaskit] into the body
 * Verify that the URL does not get automatically converted
 * Go to [https://mezzanine.jira-dev.com/wiki/spaces/WSIU/pages/23724033/HELLO] (or any other existing page in a space)
 * Create the plus icon and create a new page
 * Paste [https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/atlaskit] into the body
 * Verify that the URL gets automatically converted
fields.summary: Macro autoconvert does not work in create page

fields.description:
Customer suggests to rearrange the order of display entries on the event

As displayed below

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Different fonts for events on Calendar

fields.description:
h3. Summary
On specific instances with the upgraded structure and the new look of Confluence, when trying to click on the *Show More* for the user profile activity in Confluence (https://example.atlassian.net/wiki/display/~username), the button will not display any additional data for the user. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make sure that the user does have more than 10 recent activities in Confluence
# Once you make sure about it, with another user, access the user profile activity
# Click on the *Show More* button

h3. Expected Results
It should expand the activity feed, and display additional content that the user have edited/created in the past
h3. Actual Results
Nothing is displayed. Only the same activity prior to clicking on the button. 

!activity.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
It only affects specific instances.

h3.Workaround
No workaround found at the moment.
fields.summary: "Show More" On the User's Profile Does not Display Additional Content in Specific Instances

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Creating JIRA issues from Confluence is not updating the project list based on the selected JIRA instance selection

h3. Environment
*  

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Link 2 JIRA instances on Confluence Cloud
# Open a Confluence page
# Highlight some text and click on _create JIRA Issue_ button
# Select the other JIRA link (not the default)
# Click on the project list and it will show projects from the default JIRA

h3. Expected Results
The project list is updated when a different JIRA link is selected

h3. Actual Results
The list is not updated
h3. Notes
* 

h3.Workaround
*
fields.summary: Creating JIRA issues from Confluence is not updating the project list based on the selected JIRA instance selection

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In Confluence, if the user is one of the site administrators, the same will be able to impersonate (login) another user. However, according to the new look of Confluence, one of the modified options is the *Switch Apps*, which will also display the recent activity/access of the user:

!activity.png|thumbnail!

When impersonating another user, the activity will keep the same, avoiding the administrator to see the recent activity of the user, as the content is still triggered to the same profile. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# As an administrator, edit/collaborate with any space/page in your instance, which will make it be displayed under the *Activity* session of the application navigator
# Then, make sure to access the *User Management* (https://example.atlassian.net/admin) of the instance and *log in as user* with any other user that is not a member of the *site-admins* group since the same cannot be impersonated.
# Once logged as the user, click on the *Activity* session.

h3. Expected Results
The impersonated user should be displayed the recent activity that matches with the profile
h3. Actual Results
The activity of the administrator user is displayed, instead of the impersonated user. 

h3.Workaround
No workaround found at the moment.
fields.summary: "Recent" Session does not Change if Impersonating Other User

fields.description:
h3. Summary
 * Content Report Table macro not working to show the label star(*).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page on space.
 # Insert the label to the page.
 # Create another page and insert Content Report Table Macro.
 # Edit the Content Report Table Macro and put the star(*) in Label text box.

h3. Expected Results
 * Able to show all label on the space.

h3. Actual Results
 * The published page show to "Page Not Found".

h3. Workaround
 * No Workaround
fields.summary: Content Report Table macro not working to show the label star(*).

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Attachments operations are failing:
* attachments are not displayed
* Upload and download operations are failing.
* Backup cannot be downloaded.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Display a page with attachments on it

OR

# Attempt to download an attachment or upload one.

h3. Expected Results
Attachments are properly displayed on the page and they are downloadable.
You are also able to upload attachments.

h3. Actual Results
Attachments are not displayed on your page and it is not possible to upload or download attachments

h3.Workaround
None. We are currently looking into this new issue.
fields.summary: Attachments operations are failing

fields.description:
h3. Summary
There is a display issue when viewing Team Calendars through the URL given by the *All updates* page and using the search at the same time.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a Calendar through the *All updates* page so that it uses the format: {{https://URL.atlassian.net/wiki/display/KEY/calendars}}
# Attempt to use the Search.

h3. Expected Results
The search panel is properly displayed.

h3. Actual Results
The search panel is displayed over the calendar which can be seen (see screenshot):
 !Screen Shot 2017-10-02 at 11.49.34.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3.Workaround
Replace the *display* in the URL by *spaces* so that the format used is the following:
* {{https://URL.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/KEY/calendars}}
fields.summary: Team Calendars display issue when accessing calendars through the Activity tab

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When JIRA-only user accesses Confluence, he cannot switch back to JIRA due to 'Switch App' screen shows infinite loop.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a user with JIRA-only application access
 # Login as the user
 # Access Confluence
 # Click on the 'Hamburger' icon on the sidebar (Switch apps)

h3. Expected Results

List of available Apps as per Application Navigator should show.
h3. Actual Results

It shows a spinning wheel forever.
 !screenshot1.jpg|thumbnail!

*Application logs:*
No application log, but found error on *Development tool > Console*.
{code:java}
batch.js?externals=__local-default__&locale=en-GB:500 Failed to read NPS data from Confluence AJS.Meta (populated by confluence-frontend LegacyBridge) after 20 attempts
{code}
!screenshot2.jpg|thumbnail!
h3. Notes
 * This only happens if the user doesn't have Confluence application access. It works fine for Confluence-only users and users with both applications accesses.

h3. Workaround

Use direct link to access JIRA: https://<instance-name>.atlassian.net/secure
fields.summary: Infinite Loop on App Switcher

fields.description:
Roadmap Planner Macro is showing incorrect dates from edit version to published. The date set in edit mode is moved to a week earlier when published.

Edit Mode 
!Screenshot from 2017-10-02 17.36.57.png|thumbnail!

 

Edit Mode (Escape from Roadmap planner macro window) - *Affected instance*

!Screenshot from 2017-10-02 17.37.08.png|thumbnail!

When Published  - *Affected instance*

!Screenshot from 2017-10-02 17.37.33.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Roadmap Planner Macro - Showing Incorrect Dates, Bar moved a week earlier between edit and published mode

fields.description:
h4. Steps to reproduce
# Go to JIRA Application Navigator.
# Add a new entry OR update any application navigator links
# Go to the Confluence Application Navigator, refresh the link Or page.

h4. Expected results
Confluence application navigator is updated.

h4. Actual results
No changes. Upon clicking the *Refresh all Application Link", the XHR request, which is sent to:
<instance>/wiki/rest/capabilities-consumer/1.0/admin/refreshcache fails, with a Status of 403, and content of "XSRF check failed"

h4. Workaround
Do it the other way around. Add the link in Confluence Application Navigator first and refresh it in JIRA,
fields.summary: Confluence Application Navigator unable to sync with JIRA Application Navigator

fields.description:
h3. Summary
 * Multimedia macro is not working.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page.
 # Attached video with .SWF extension.
 # Insert multimedia macro.
 # Allow Adobe Flash Player on the browser.

h3. Expected Results
 * Able to run the video with .SWF extension on Confluence page.

h3. Actual Results
 * No display on Confluence page for SWF video.

h3. Workaround
 * Upload the video with .SWF extension to external website (e.g youtube) and use Widget connector macro.
fields.summary: Multimedia macro is not working.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* Global search showing the deleted attachment.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page.
# Attach file (e.g test.yml.txt).
# Open (...)ellipsis menu > Attachments > View the attachment.
# Copy the URL of the view attachment. e.g https://example.atlassian.net/wiki/pages/viewpageattachments.action?pageId=3768447&preview=/3768447/3735615/test.yml.txt
# Open the attachment preview URL e.g https://example.atlassian.net/wiki/pages/viewpageattachments.action?pageId=3768447&preview=/3768447/3735615/test.yml.txt
# Delete the attachment.
# Search in global search, the test.yml.txt.
# Click it will preview the attachment file.

h3. Expected Results
* Not able to search the deleted attachment file.

h3. Actual Results
* Able to search the deleted attachment file.

h3.Workaround
* No workaround.
fields.summary: Global search showing the deleted attachment.

fields.description:
In Confluence, the user can work with [different set of permissions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/space-permissions-overview-139521.html] for space. However, we do not have an option to specifically disable/restrict the download of attachments in the page/space. 

This is a suggestion to have an option/permission to allow users to download attachments or not.
fields.summary: Permission to Disable Attachments Download

fields.description:
With the [Confluence's new look|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/new-navigation-and-a-new-look-for-confluence-881536766.html], when the user has a couple of pages in the sidebar, a scrollbar will be displayed:

!Screen Shot 2017-09-29 at 3.46.09 PM.png|thumbnail!

However, the scrollbar will be between the pages and the option to expand/collapse the sidebar. It's almost 1px of difference, which might be difficult for the user to use the scrollbar itself. Attached is a video about the behavior.

This is a suggestion to increase the width of the scrollbar in the sidebar.
fields.summary: Increase Scrollbar's Width for the Sidebar

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Cannot link to a Space's homepage from a JIRA issue

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On an instance with JIRA and Confluence, create a JIRA issue
# Go to *...* or *More* > *Link* > *Confluence Page*
# Paste a Confluence's URL from a space's homepage / search for a page that's a Space's homepage

h3. Expected Results
The link should be created.

h3. Actual Results
The link isn't created and the window shows an error like below:
{code}
No Confluence page found with the given URL.
{code}
fields.summary: Cannot link to a Space's homepage from a JIRA issue

fields.description:
h3. Summary * Page containing a lot of Jira macro on the same page makes all the Jira macro is not working. h3. Steps to Reproduce # Create a page. # Insert Jira issue macro more than 10. h3. Expected Results * Jira issue macro working properly. h3. Actual Results * Jira issue macro not working. h3. Workaround * Decrease the number of Jira issue macro on the same page. h3. Error message {code}Caused by: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Duplicate key [

{code}
Key Summary T Assignee P Status Resolution
fields.summary: Page containing a lot of Jira macro on the same page makes all the Jira macro is not working.

fields.description: Not having the ability to keep inline comments when we cut/copy and paste table rows from one page to another is very limiting for us in our daily work and so we would like to request this feature to be implemented.
fields.summary: Copy/Cut&Paste table rows from one page to another doesn't keep inline comments

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When browsing directly to a page with the Anchor tag specified, If the page has data that takes time to load in, the page will jump to the location of the Anchor, and then the slow-loading content populates and shifts all content below it down. This creates the effect that the user is "jumped" twice. Once to the desired content, and then again further up the page.

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
- Create a page with a large amount of content and a large number of sections.
- Place a table of contents macro at the top of the page. (The objective is to create a large table of contents.
- Copy the URL from one of the links.
-Browse Directly to the URL copied from the link in a new window

h3. Expected Results

User viewport is focused on the Anchor point.

h3. Actual Results
User View port is focused on the location of the Anchor point, but then the dynamically loaded content pushes all content below it down, causing the viewport to appear to jump up.
 
h3. Notes
N/A

h3.Workaround
There is no workaround at this time.
fields.summary: Slow loading content causes Anchor URLs to jump to wrong spot in page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When you insert an email address with a leading underscore in the local part the link to this email can't be clicked to open the default mail app. There's no "mailto:" link.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page and add an email with a leading underscore
# Save the page and try to click the email address link

h3. Expected Results
The link would have a "mailto:"  link and open the default mail app when clicked.
h3. Actual Results
There's no "mailto:" link and nothing happens when the email is clicked.
fields.summary: Email address with a leading underscore can't be clicked

fields.description:
I have a page template that contains a task report macro. I want the macro to display task report for the current page (and children).

However, there's no @current parameter for the page property and since it's a template, no page name is available yet.

So the workaround is to just place the task report macro. Then when a new page is created, we must first publish it, the go back to edit the page and modify the task report "page" property and select the newly created page.

For us, this is a major nuisance in our meeting reports in Confluence. Can this be added?
fields.summary: Insert task report for current page in template

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The 'Insert Link' button on Questions opens a box to enter the link.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add back the old 'link' method that allowed user entering a URL or searching for a Confluence page.

h3. Why this is important
User needs to search for the page on a new Confluence tab in order to copy the link.

h3. Workaround
fields.summary: Add the possibility to search for pages on insert link button of Questions

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Google Chrome's spellchecker can't handle large pages (3000+ words)

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Using Chrome, create a page in Confluence
# On the editor, add text larger than 3000+ words

h3. Expected Results
Google Chrome spellchecker should mark in red all mispelled/unknown words

h3. Actual Results
Google Chrome's spellchecker only marks words until a random point on the page

h3. Notes
While on the editor, the page's performance is significantly affected.
fields.summary: Google Chrome's spellchecker can't handle large pages (3000+ words)

fields.description:
h3. Problem
Looks like enabling 'Disable Autoformatting' in the profile Editor settings inhibits the autocomplete when using @ mentions. 

It's not immediately clear to us whether @ mentions are necessarily associated with "Auto Formatting". We think of @ mentions as Confluence functionality, not necessarily editor auto formatting. The description isn't particularly clear what the full impact of disabling autoformatting will be.

h3. Suggestion
Clarify this in the description or determine if disabling autoformatting should impact @ mentions.
fields.summary: Clarify and Specify of Autoformatting

fields.description:
In Confluence, the content related to the user is displayed with full names (e.g. created by, last modified by). 

As a user, it would be good if it was possible to select between displaying such information using usernames as well.
fields.summary: Display Usernames instead of Full Name for Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When clicking on JIRA Macro/report links inserted on Confluence pages, the user will be redirected to the Jira issue, in the Jira instance, which is expected. However, once the user is in JIRA, if the same clicks on the back arrow of the browser to return to the previous page, it will only refresh the issue and the user will not be redirected back to Confluence.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On Confluence, edit a page and insert a *Jira* macro with an existing issue from Jira
# Publish the page
# Once the page is updated, click on the link to the Jira issue.
# Click on the back arrow of the browser

h3. Expected Results
The user should be redirected back to Confluence
h3. Actual Results
It just refreshes the Jira issue, keeping the user in Jira. 

h3. Notes
Tested with Chrome and Firefox

h3.Workaround
No workaround found at the moment.
fields.summary: Not able to Click Back on the Browser When Clicking on Jira Macros Links

fields.description: Copy of CONFSERVER-52385 for CONFCLOUD
fields.summary: Editor Shortcut for Merge Cells

fields.description:
Hi, 

We are looking for a 2 languages site, which  allow users to obtain a link to another translated page. I have tested to add a flag (a picture that links to another page)  at the top right of the page, but the layout finally puts the flag on the left side.

When I move the picture with the mouse, it always appears at the beginning of the line.

If I put a lot of space characters, when I publlish the page, it appears on the middle.

Is there a solution to place a picture (a flag) on the top right into the published page ?

Thank you,

Lionel.
fields.summary: Flag in prder to link to another page

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Confluence keeps reloading page if header or footer includes pagetree macro specifying {{root=}} parameter.

h3. Environment
 * Confluence with SPA

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to [https://example.atlassian.net/wiki/admin/custompagecontent.action], and set Footer as follows:
{code:none}
Footer starts.
{pagetree:root=}
Footer ends.
{code}
# Open any page and verify the following behaviors are happening:
** Confluence warns "The following macros are not currently supported in the footer: pagetree"
** Page reload causes infinite loop

 !Screenshot 2017-09-28 15.22.52.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Expected Results

Pagetree macro in header or footer doesn't cause infinite loop.
h3. Actual Results

Pagetree macro in header or footer causes infinite loop.
h3. Notes
 * This started occurring after enabling SPA
 * Infinite loop happens only if pagetree specifies {{root=}} parameter

h3. Workaround

Remove {{root=}} parameter from the pagetree macro.
fields.summary: Pagetree macro in header and footer causes infinite loop page reload

fields.description:
With the upgrade to the new look of confluence, the side-bar requires some additional hops in the interface that can be confusing and frustrating to use.

Because the sidebar functions as an immutable interface item, the fact that the context changes the available options so widely makes the sidebar feel like it is not the place to look for what you want.

Currently, it is not possible to navigate to specific pages via the page tree from the space home page. Furthermore the ability to jump to the Space tools without first returning to the space-level context via the "<-- Pages" button.

This makes the customer experience seem fragmented into a "space" level context and a "page" level context that could be improved by allowing one to have the control that they need available at all times.

To resolve this I propose the following changes:
- Add the space tools navigation into the three-line menu (the one that allows switching apps)
- Add the page tree as an expandable control to the side-bar. Space shortcuts are nice, but it would be better to have the pages easily available for navigation at all times.
fields.summary: Please add Confluence Sidebar Menu items for common actions.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Chrome and Safari Users are unable to copy and paste data from multiple cells; if multiple Cells are copied, when pasted, the content is added in a single cell

h3. Environment
- Cloud 
-- Chrome Version 60.0.3112.113 (Official Build) (64-bit)
-- Safari Version 11.0 (12604.1.38.1.7)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page with a Table; example 3x3 and add content to the first 2 rows
# Add a new Row to the Table, highlight text across multiple cells within the Table and Paste into the new row

h3. Expected Results
Pasted Data retains Cell Position

h3. Actual Results
In Chrome/Safari:
 !Chrome.png|thumbnail! 

Using Firefox:
 !Firefox.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Initially discovered as being caused when a Table is nested within another table, however we're now seeing this issue with a standalone table

h3.Workaround
- Copy cells individually or, 
- Use Firefox
- Chrome users may be able to workaround this issue by clearing Browser Cache or deleting [local browser storage|https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=762874705] used by the Cloud Instance
fields.summary: Table Cell Pasting Issues With Chrome and Safari

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* Ability to create a new template similar to the default retrospective template.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page.
# Choose Retrospective template.
# Showing the window to put the value Current date and mention username.(Please see the screenshot).

h3. Expected Results
* Able to create a new template similar the retrospective template.
fields.summary: Ability to create a new template similar to the default restropective template.
